title: Live news: The week ahead

description: Financial price moves are telling a different story to some of the more pessimistic forecasts for the country

title: Tax offset on Ulez clean air levy set to be ‘shot in arm’ for London white van man
description: Tradespeople with polluting vehicles will be able to claim back cost of driving in expanded low emissions zone

description: Lego reports and Japan aims to become the fifth nation to reach the moon

title: France to pay farmers €200mn for destroying wine surplus
description: Winemakers told they must ‘adapt’ as demand falls among French drinkers and sales drop in China

title: US commerce secretary visits Beijing to boost business ties
description: Raimondo’s trip part of efforts to stabilise relations even as Washington tightens restrictions on Chinese tech

title: Rachel Reeves rules out wealth tax under Labour
description: Shadow chancellor asserts party’s commitment to fiscal discipline, pledges to hold down public spending

title: Germany’s ruling party plans to curb rent increases
description: SDP set to unveil measures to tackle soaring costs facing tenants, says senior lawmaker

title: Politics, as well as economics, matter when making climate policy
description: The social impact of measures taken is as important as their efficiency

description: Market Questions is the FT’s guide to the week ahead

title: Corporate sponsors turn against Spain football chief over World Cup kiss
description: Companies distance themselves from Luis Rubiales, who has been suspended over his actions after last weekend’s match

title: DNA results confirm Prigozhin’s death, Moscow says
description: Wagner warlord led a mutiny against Russian military leadership in June

description: The appeal of Nayib Bukele in El Salvador is a threat to the region’s democratic success

description: Brits were more likely to opt for a bolt hole in France or Spain 10 years ago

description: Incumbent Emmerson Mnangagwa declared victor while opposition vows to contest result

description: Imported machines designed to serve diners in restaurants outnumber homemade rivals

description: Applicants encouraged to focus on hardships they have overcome while colleges seek proxies for race in admissions

description: Bucharest seeks to double capacity of alternative shipping route through Danube river, says prime minister

description: The proliferation of cheap, shortlived garments has come at an enormous environmental and social cost. The EU is preparing to end it

title: Power-starved North Korea turns to solar energy to keep the lights on
description: Cheaper panels and increasing domestic assembly offer an alternative to regime’s dilapidated electricity grid
